item.title: Simple rs highscore checker
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:16, topic:38839”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=54676.msg728444#msg728444 date=1167827669]

while(true){

:o

Well as long as it has a break; in it someplace its ok, sometimes it is the best way to work things.
[/quote]“sometimes” as in when?

I have used a while(true) for taking input from the command line with the Scanner class, because I wanted to continue asking for input until I got what I was asking for. (such as the correct type, correct answer, etc etc…)

It can be convenient, yes. It isn’t very good coding practise though.[/quote]

In some places it is needed though, how else would you read command line input until the input was valid?

Read full topic

item.title: Simple rs highscore checker
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

sense the paste bin is down i wrote this for another project i was working on

[code]import java.io.;
import java.net.;

public class SimpleHighscore{

public static BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader( System.in ) );
public static void main(String[] args)throws IOException {
while(true){
System.out.print( “Enter a Username to lookup:” );

	getStats(br.readLine());
}	
}
public static void getStats(String username){
	String rank[] = new String[24];
	String level[] = new String[24];
	String xp[] = new String[24];
	String skill[] =  {"Overall","Attack", "Defence", "Strength", "Hitpoints", "Ranged","Prayer", "Magic", "Cooking", "Woodcutting", "Fletching", "Fishing","Firemaking", "Crafting", "Smithing", "Mining", "Herblore", "Agility","Thieving","Slayer","Farming","Runecraft","Construction","Hunting"};
	int count = 0;
	int skillid = 0;
	try {
    		URL url = new URL("http://hiscore.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/hiscorepersonal.ws?user1="+username);
    			BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream()));
    			String str;
			while ((str = in.readLine()) != null) {
			if(str.contains("<td align=\"right\">")){
				count++;
				if(count == 2){
					rank[skillid] = str.substring(str.indexOf(">")+1 ,str.lastIndexOf("<"));
				}
				if(count == 3){
					level[skillid] = str.substring(str.indexOf(">")+1 ,str.lastIndexOf("<"));
				}
				if(count == 4){	
					xp[skillid] = str.substring(str.indexOf(">")+1 ,str.lastIndexOf("<"));	
					count = 0;
					skillid++;
				}				
			}
    		}
    		in.close();
			} catch (MalformedURLException e) {
			} catch (IOException e) {
			}
		System.out.println("Stats for " + username);
		for(int x = 0; x < skillid; x++){
			System.out.println("Skill: "+skill[x]);
			System.out.println("Rank: "+rank[x]);
			System.out.println("Level: "+level[x]);	
			System.out.println("Experience: "+xp[x]+"\n");
		}
		System.out.println("======= Done! by MissSilabSoft =======\n");
	}

}[/code]

Read full topic
